intro: Trigonella eremophila, commonly known as the desert fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by slender, erect pods containing seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments through deep root systems and drought tolerance. Trigonella eremophila is often found in sandy soils and is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes.
